item.description:
SOLD OUT! 


The Coolidge Corner Theatre is proud to present an evening of Cuban culture. 

We are excited to host this night of performance by iconic Cuban singer/songwriter Carlos Varela. The concert, Varela’s only Boston show, is part of an eight-city U.S. tour sponsored by his longtime friend and supporter Jackson Browne.

Often compared to Bob Dylan and Bruce Springsteen, Varela is one of his country’s most popular folk/rock musical artists and a major figure in Latin American music. For more than 20 years, he has been drawing thousands of passionate fans to his shows, even when his songs were banned from Cuban radio.

Varela’s music combines Cuba’s Nueva Trova tradition of richly poetic, socially conscious lyrics with an innovative fusion of folk, rock, and pop. Upbeat and defiant, soothing and soulful, he can rock the audience out of their seats and then break their hearts with his beautiful, haunting songs about love, loss, freedom, hope, and daily life in Cuba. His songs have given voice to Cubans longing for change and a greater connection to the outside world, and have inspired people around the world.

Varela has recorded eight albums, the latest of which is  No Es El Fin ( It is Not the End), released in the summer of 2009. He has performed in countries worldwide, and has shared the stage with Jackson Browne, Bonnie Raitt, Ruben Blades, Sting, Luis Enrique, Francisco Céspedes, Joaquín Sabina, Silvio Rodriguez, Miguel Bosé, Los Van Van, and many others.

Jackson Browne will be on hand to introduce Varela and to read English translations of some of the Cuban superstar’s songs.

Opening the show, we have a presentation of the works of world renowned Cuban artist, Jose Fuster, often referred to as “the Picasso of the Caribbean”. Fuster is known for his whimsical approach to art. He has taken old, discarded LP record albums and turned them into works of art by creating paintings on them. His son, Alex, will introduce Boston to his work, which will displayed for sale in the theatre's lobby, and show a short film on the artistry of Jose Fuster.

This is a rare opportunity to hear one of Cuba’s most emblematic musicians, and to view, and purchase, the work of one of its most revered artists . Not to be missed!

 

See You at the Movies,

 

John
item.how_to_find_us: Tickets in hand, we will gather at Panera Bread in order to gather before the film. We will be in line by 6:30 in order to get good seats for the show. With the weather expected to be nice, look for John holding a Meetup Sign at a table outside.
